description: Variation of condition 2 (approved drawings) and condition 5 (extract system) of planning permission ref: PP/2015/6813 dated 17/02/2016 for the change of use from retail unit (use class A1), plant room and public toilet facilities to restaurant (use class A3), provision of outdoor seating to Oak Road; external alterations to shop frontages; installation of ground floor level extract ducting to rear elevation. Variation to provide for the enlargement of the louvered areas within the approved doors and an alteration to the approved extract system
decision_conditions: 1.	The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of planning permission PP/2015/6813 dated 17/02/2016.
REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
2.	The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) 386, 234_SHG_GA_M4 and 388.
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
3.	All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those as described on the approved plans and as described within the submitted application form.

REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (g) (h), 1.2 (f) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan - Consolidated (2016).

4.	The rating noise level emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 2014, will not exceed the existing background sound level, as measured at the nearest sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.

REASON: In the interests of safeguarding the residential amenity of nearby residents in accordance with policies 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 Noise and Vibration, and London Plan (July 2011) policy 7.15.

5. The development shall provide for the installation, operation and maintenance of the best practicable cooking extract system, including the provision of a suitable extract fan and odour control equipment. The details shall satisfy the advice at "DEFRA: 2005: Guidance on the Control of Odour and Noise from Commercial Kitchen Exhaust Systems". The system shall be completed before occupation and thereafter permanently retained and maintained.
REASON: To protect the living conditions of adjacent occupiers in accordance with policies 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan and London Plan 2016 policy 7.14.

6.	Prior to occupation of the development, the ventilation duct from the commercial premises, shall be fixed to the external wall with suitable anti - vibration isolators and the fan motor shall be vibration isolated from the duct, so as to satisfy an acoustic standard of not exceeding LFNR25 Leq 5mins (octaves) or LFNR20 Leq 5mins (one-third octaves) inside a bedroom and LFNR 30 (Leq 5mins) (octaves) or LFNR 25 (Leq 5mins) (one-third octaves) inside a living room.

REASON: In the interests of safeguarding the residential amenity of nearby residents in accordance with policies 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 Noise and Vibration, and London Plan 2016 policy 7.15.
7.	The mechanical ventilation system shall be in accordance with the details approved under application reference 166637REM.
REASON: To protect the living conditions of adjacent occupiers in accordance with policies 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan and London Plan 2016 policy 7.14.

8.	The hours of operation shall be restricted to 0800 - 23:00hrs Sundays to Thursdays and 08:00 - 23:30hrs Fridays and Saturdays. The use of the external seating area shall not take place between the hours of 22:00-08:00 hrs. Deliveries of goods to, and waste collections from the proposed development shall only take place during the period 0800 - 1800 hrs on Mondays to Saturdays and at no time on Sundays and Public Holidays.

REASON: In the interests of safeguarding the residential amenity of nearby residents in accordance with policies 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 Noise and Vibration, and London Plan 2016 policy 7.15.
9.	The proposed external lighting scheme shall be designed to reduce light pollution to nearby residents, and where applicable the recommendations of the following guidance shall be met:
- ILP Guidance Notes for the reduction of Obtrusive Lighting 2011.
- CIE Technical Report- Guide on the Limitation of the Effects of Obtrusive Light from Outdoor Lighting Installations - CIE 150: 2003
- Institution of Lighting Professionals Technical Report No PLG05, Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements, 2015.
- CIE Technical Report- Guide on the Limitation of the Effects of Obtrusive Light from Outdoor Lighting Installations - CIE 150: 2003.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of surrounding occupiers in accordance with policy 7.6 of the adopted London Plan (2016), policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
